title: 106_s1288
content: Community Forest Restoration Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, to establish a cooperative forest restoration program in New Mexico to provide cost-share grants to stakeholders for experimental forest restoration projects to be designed through a collaborative process . Requires a project to address specified objectives, including: (1) wildfire threat reduction, (2) ecosystem restoration, including non-native tree species reduction, (3) reestablishment of historic fire regimes, (3) reforestation, including preservation of old trees, (4) small diameter tree use enhancement, (5) creation of forest- related local employment. And (6) stakeholder diversity. Limits projects to four years. Sets forth provisions respecting: (1) collaborative project selection, (2) monitoring and evaluation, (3) reporting, and (4) cost limits. Authorizes appropriations.
